title: BT teams up with Hubbub for smart home technology trial
lead: ​The Smarter Living Challenge has been launching by BT and Hubbub to explore how technology can reduce household carbon emissions.
author: Alice Grundy

title: EDF continues energy storage push with PowerUp investment
lead: ​EDF has invested in cleantech startup PowerUp in a bid to support its 10GW of storage by 2035 ambitions.
author: Alice Grundy

title: National Infrastructure Strategy unveiled detailing 'ambitious' energy commitments
lead: Measures to improve the UK's green infrastructure - including the creation of a UK infrastructure bank, a ramping up of electric vehicle policy and funding for hydrogen and carbon capture and storage - have been detailed by the government.
author: Alice Grundy

title: Negative pricing extended in CfD rules as clarity on energy storage, renewables integration yet to come
lead: The government has confirmed that it will extend the negative pricing rule for projects bidding in next year’s Contracts for Difference (CfD) auction, but will further consult with the industry on potential amendments for energy storage and system flexibility.
author: Liam Stoker

title: Little energy funding highlighted in Sunak’s Spending Review
lead: ​Little was announced as part of this afternoon’s Spending Review that directly related to the energy sector, despite Chancellor Rishi Sunak stating that the government was "setting the direction" for green energy.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: COVID-19 could be a catalyst for a ‘greener, more sustainable future’ says Octopus Renewables
lead: ​As governments turn their eyes to a green recovery, 80% of institutional investors are planning to increase their investment into renewable energy.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: Fast charging key to enabling European EV uptake
lead: ​Increasing European fast charging options would convince 66% of future electric vehicle (EV) drivers to switch sooner.
author: Alice Grundy

title: Bulb appoints new CFO to support 100 million members goal
lead: ​Bulb has unveiled the appointment of Paul Albin as its new chief financial officer as it looks to continue to expand.
author: Alice Grundy

title: Smart on-street EV charging project launched in ‘industry first’
lead: ​A project exploring smart on-street subsurface electric vehicle (EV) charging has been unveiled by Element Energy.
author: Alice Grundy

title: Offshore wind commitments boost UK to top five in renewable attractiveness
lead: ​The UK has continued to climb EY’s Renewable Energy Country Attractiveness Index (RECAI), jumping up one place to fifth..
author: Alice Grundy

title: Octopus Energy to make 'big green dent' as it launches in Germany
lead: ​Octopus Energy has taken its first steps into Germany following the acquisition of Munich-based 4hundred in 2019.
author: Alice Grundy

title: UK ‘at a fork in the road’ as research reveals increased flexibility could save £270m annually
lead: ​New analysis from technology group Wärtsilä has found that flexibility technologies can rapidly increase the share of renewables at a lower overall cost.
author: Alice Grundy

title: Net zero at heart of £2bn Scottish National Investment Bank
lead: ​The Scottish National Investment Bank has been launched with net zero as a key area of investment.
author: Alice Grundy

title: Current± Disruptors: Equiwatt’s Johnson Fernandes and Geoff Phillips on gamification and flexibility
lead: Current± caught up with Equiwatt founder and CEO Johnson Fernandes and CMO Geoff Phillips to talk about how the app works and what’s next for the startup.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: Household bills could jump £21 as Ofgem consults on managing ‘bad debt’ through tariff changes
lead: ​Ofgem is consulting on amending the default tariff price cap, in a move that would increase household energy bills by £21 per household.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: Mayor of London announces £10m fund to help make capital ‘cleaner, greener and fairer’
lead: ​The Mayor of London Sadiq Khan has announced £10 million towards a Green New Deal, aimed at helping create jobs in sectors including clean energy.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: Kaluza launches new smart charging trial with Fiat
lead: ​Kaluza has signed a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) with automaker Fiat Chrysler Automobiles (FCA) to develop a ‘cheaper, simpler and more sustainable’ electric vehicle (EV) charging services.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: SSE to treble renewable output as it releases strong interim results
lead: ​SSE is set to treble its renewable output by 2030 thanks to an attractive pipeline of projects, and is on track to add 1GW of new capacity annually in the second half of the decade.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: Investment must double to £400bn over next decade for UK to reach net zero
lead: ​For the UK to reach its net zero target, £40 billion a year will be needed in infrastructure spending, double current levels.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: October sees a quarter of a million smart meters installed in 2020 high
lead: ​The number of smart meters rolled out in October hit a record high, with almost a quarter of a million installations.
author: Molly Lempriere
